title: How Like a Winter
text:
How Like a Winter is a <a href="gothic%20metal">gothic</a> <a href="doom%20metal">doom metal</a> <a href="band%20%28music%29">band</a> from Italy that was formed in the mid-1990s, although their first recording wasn't until much later. The band's music, which can be described as atmospheric and melancholy, is composed using violins, various classical, <a href="acoustic%20guitar">acoustic</a> and electric guitars, and features male and female vocalists; the band members all use evocative pseudonyms. Male vocals are both clean and growled, whereas the female duo of Tragedy and Misery are invariably clean. Delicate violins mingle with heavy guitar riffs and are complemented by acoustic guitar solos. The band's music has been likened to that of <a href="Paradise%20Lost%20%28band%29">Paradise Lost</a>, Celestial Season, <a href="Novembers%20Doom">Novembers Doom</a>, <a href="Shape%20of%20Despair">Shape of Despair</a>, and <a href="My%20Dying%20Bride">My Dying Bride</a>. Guitarist Mist lists My Dying Bride as a great inspiration, along with <a href="Opeth">Opeth</a> and <a href="Katatonia">Katatonia</a> among others.
Their first recording was the 2001 demo-CD "<a href="The%20Winter%27s%20Near">The Winter's Near</a>". The band subsequently released their full-length album "...Beyond My Grey Wake" in 2003. Both CDs were recorded at Temple of Noise studios, Rome, Italy. The release of their debut full-length album was met by very favourable reviews from magazines including Vampire Magazine, Digital Metal and Metal Edge. Martyr Music Group stated "Early in the year (2003) How Like a Winter's debut CD "<a href="...Beyond%20My%20Grey%20Wake">...Beyond My Grey Wake</a>" comes out and the response was simply phenomenal".
The band are currently working on new material.
Etymology.
The band's name is taken from the first line of <a href="Shakespeare">William Shakespeare</a>'s <a href="sonnet">sonnet</a> XCVII:- "How like a winter hath my absence been".
